definition: to advise/to urge/to try to persuade/to exhort/to console/to soothe
to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue

sentences.english: He was supposed to give us advice, but this ideas were airy-fairy ideas.
sentences.chinese: 他應該給我們提些勸告，但他的主意都是不切實際的。

sentences.english: It is waste of time, admonishing you.
sentences.chinese: 勸告你簡直是浪費工夫。

sentences.english: or to exhort somebody to do something or not to do something.
sentences.chinese: 或者勸告某人做或不做一些事情。

sentences.english: I benefited from my mother's advice.
She hesitated whether she would take our advice.
sentences.chinese: 她對是否接受我們的勸告猶豫不定。

sentences.english: My expostulation ( s ) had no effect.
sentences.chinese: 我提出的勸告毫無作用。

sentences.english: I can do without your advice, if you don't mind.
sentences.chinese: 要是你不介意，我用不着你的勸告。

sentences.english: She likes the submissive person,and doesn't hear any advices.
sentences.chinese: 她喜歡唯唯諾諾的人，根本聽不進所有其他人的勸告。

sentences.english: If you take(follow) my advice, you'll pass the exam.
sentences.chinese: 如果你聽我的勸告，你會考及格。

sentences.english: So much for the reverend's exhortations to emulate the ways of the dunnock .
sentences.chinese: 牧師勸告人們學習籬雀的生活方式不過如此。

sentences.english: Don't throw my warnings to the wind.
sentences.chinese: 別把我的勸告當耳邊風。

sentences.english: At Lola's advice she had had some pictures taken by Sarony.
sentences.chinese: 她聽從蘿拉的勸告，曾經請薩羅尼爲她拍了幾張照片。

sentences.english: They accepted his advice and rescinded the original plan.
sentences.chinese: 他們聽從了他的勸告，撤銷了原計劃。

sentences.english: The NATO player is advised to utilize the terrain and engineer units to dig in.
sentences.chinese: 給北約玩家的勸告是使用地形與工兵單位去挖地洞。

sentences.english: His advice determined me to delay no more.
sentences.chinese: 他的勸告使我決定不再拖延。

definition: to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
to be determined to/to insist on
to follow the track of an overturned cart/to repeat a disastrous policy
to confuse one thing with another (idiom); to muddle
